availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: A vacancy having occured in the office of Presiding Judge of Johnson County by the Resgnation of Thomas S Brown for a less term than three years, and we the undersigned being a Majority of the Justices of the Peace in and for said County of Johnson. having met at the Court house in the town of Paintsville on Monday the 24th day of March 1862 for the purpose of filling said vacancy after balloting as required by the statute. we hereby certify that James Remy was duly elected or chosen to fill Said vacancy of Presiding Judge of Johnson County
Given under our hands this 24th day of March 1862

Jacob Castle J. P. J. C.
E. Lemaster J P J C
B F Salyer J. P. J. C.
Nathaniel P SimerJ P J C
Lewis Todd J. P. J. C.
Wm J Currier J. P. J. C.
John Wells J. P. J. C

A Copy
att John Hawes clerk
Johnson County Court

Johnson Co.
Jas Remy
Pr. Judge
Comd Apr 24 1862
